Shit, man. You're pretty much talking about Nirvana in post-mortem. It's usually pretty easy to remember *those things*. Remembering what they (alongside plenty of others did....i.e. Melvins, Mudhoney, Soundgarden, etc, etc).
What the thing is; is that these fuckers perservered. Despite the tides. And by "tides", I mean they were going against the current. This particular 'current', being *music*. If you can't appreciate that...well, I don't know what to tell you. They were progressives. Just like I see Buscemi as. He's got a funny look and mannerisms to him (not really IMHO), but people like to see realism on film. We, in-turn say, we like what we see, by paying $ for films and the cycle continues.
Steve Buscemi, in my book, is one of the greatest actors of my time. Character roles, or Boardwalk, or not.
